page.title: 03MILITARY HOSPITAL
page.content: The Duchess of Kent{Military Hospital} at Catterick Garrison was completed in 1976 and was officially opened by the {Duchess of Kent}on 6.10.76.It replaced the old hospital built in 1915.It draws militatry patients from Scotland,North of England right down to Nottingham.Anyone in an accident on the A1 between R.A.F.Catterick and Scotch Corner,or the A66 will be taken to this hospital.There are 6 wards with 150 army beds and 22 civilian beds.7 to 10 nurses are on duty on a ward in the daytime and 2 staff are on duty on each ward at night.The average lenght of stay for a student nurse is 1 year and 2 years for a qualified nurse.The army nurses belong to the {Queen Alexandra's Royal Nursing Corps} formed in 1902.They wear a grey dress and their epaulets show their rank.
